result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Ashley N Hafferkamp

records.addlTxt:
Prosecuting attorney Vivien L. TenHaken in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Ashley N Hafferkamp appeared by phone.  Attorney Larry R Pruden in court for Ashley N Hafferkamp. Minutes filed.
Motion hearing scheduled for September 16, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
Request for defendant to appear by phone. "She can appear by phone". PAK 8/3/2022

Defendant Ashley N Hafferkamp appeared by video, in custody.  Plaintiff State of Wisconsin in court by DDA James Sempf.  Attorney Larry R Pruden in court for Ashley N Hafferkamp. Called @ 3:16 p.m. Appearances made. Matter before the Court for first status on 22CF252 and 22CF225, and 2nd status on 22CF32. Record by Atty. Pruden who has just received an offer and needs to go over it with the defendant. Response by the Court that matters are already assigned to Judge Koss and sets all matters on his calendar after August 1, 2022. Court in recess.
Status conference scheduled for August 4, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Notice of Motion and Motion for Establishment of Discovery Deadlines.

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Prosecutor

records.addlTxt: Scheduling Order will be provided to Attys via e-filing by the Court
Not guilty plea entered by counsel and trial reserved

Prosecuting attorney Samuel Thomas Berg in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Ashley N Hafferkamp in court, in custody by video .  Attorney Larry R Pruden in court for Ashley N Hafferkamp. Defendant advised of right to and waived preliminary hearing. Court ordered defendant bound over. Not guilty plea entered by counsel and trial reserved. Minutes filed.
Status conference scheduled for June 16, 2022 at 03:00 pm.

Defendant in court in custody via video with atty Larry Pruden. ADA Berg appears for the State of Wisconsin. Initial appearance. Reading waived. Charges. Defendant has questions regarding her charges. Atty Pruden to visit defendant in jail. Minutes filed.
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for May 11, 2022 at 01:15 pm.

Defendant Ashley N Hafferkamp in court, in custody by video. Vivien TenHaken appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Attorney Larry Pruden appeared. Motion to modify bond by Attorney Pruden, argument, state objects to modification. Denied. Defendant would reside with father if released. Future dates remain as scheduled. Minutes filed.
Signed bond filed with the court.

BOND TO COVER 22GF410, 22CF225, & 22CF32

DEFENDANT MUST POST $1000 CASH

Defendant shall not possess or consume alcohol. Defendant shall not possess or use illegal drugs or drug paraphernalia. Defendant will not possess any firearms, ammunition or other weapons. Defendant is to be booked and printed within twenty-four (24) hours. Defendant will not in any way contact or attempt to contact any victim(s) listed and will avoid their residence/place of employment or any place they are located and will avoid causing any other person, other than defendant's attorney, from doing so on defendant's behalf.  The term "no contact" is hereby defined as through the mail, by telephone, by way of electronic device, in person, or through a third party.  VICTIM(S)/RESIDENCE(S): P.P.

Defendant Ashley N Hafferkamp in court, in custody by video. JJ Crawford appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Attorney Leah Selmek appeared for bond purposes only. Motion to modify bond by Attorney Selmek. Argument, granted. Minutes filed.
Hearing scheduled for May 6, 2022 at 01:15 pm.

DEFENDANT MUST POST $2000 CASH

Defendant shall not possess or consume alcohol. Defendant shall not possess or use illegal drugs or drug paraphernalia. Defendant will not possess any firearms, ammunition or other weapons. Defendant is to be booked and printed within twenty-four (24) hours. Defendant will not in any way contact or attempt to contact any victim(s) listed and will avoid their residence/place of employment or any place they are located and will avoid causing any other person, other than defendant's attorney, from doing so on defendant's behalf.  The term "no contact" is hereby defined as through the mail, by telephone, by way of electronic device, in person, or through a third party.  VICTIM(S)/RESIDENCE(S): P.P.
Signed bond filed with the court.
